drawer.translation[0].definitions[0].def: part of a piece of furniture, such as a desk, that you pull out and push in and use to keep things in
drawer.translation[0].definitions[0].not: sock/cutlery drawer (=one for keeping socks, or knives, forks etc in)
drawer.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: She took a file from her desk drawer.
The scissors are in the kitchen drawer  (=drawer in a piece of kitchen furniture).
He opened the top drawer of his desk, and took out a brown envelope.
drawer.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: He opened the bottom drawer and got out a T-shirt.
The passports are in my desk drawer.
There's some string in that kitchen drawer.
He hid the gun in his sock drawer.
Have you looked in the left-hand drawer?
Jonathan opened the drawer and took out a fork.
He pulled open drawers until he found the papers.
She shut the drawer and locked it with a small key.
I've been through all my drawers and I can't find it.
Someone had been in my bedroom and rummaged through my drawers.
drawer.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a person who writes a cheque and so gives an instruction to his or her bank to pay a sum of money to someone
drawer.translation[1].definitions[1].def: words written by a bank on a cheque that has not been paid, usually because there is not enough money in the account of the person who wrote it
drawer.translation[1].definitions[2].def: a person who signs a BILL OF EXCHANGE that gives an instruction to another person to pay a sum of money at a particular time
